metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1139 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way samba before 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 allowed the use of weak NTLMv1 authentication even when NTLMv1 was explicitly disabled. A man-in-the-middle attacker could use this flaw to read the credential and other details passed between the samba server and client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13

No subscription required
